metadata.title: CVE-2020-12398 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
If Thunderbird is configured to use STARTTLS for an IMAP server, and theserver sends a PREAUTH response, then Thunderbird will continue with anunencrypted connection, causing email data to be sent without protection.This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 68.9.0.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12398` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
